title: Assessment Manager
description:
**Position Summary:**

The Assessment Manager is responsible for providing oversight and management to the Service Coordination Team and the DTS/Timekeeper. This includes the management, development, implementation, and delivery of various assessments to determine current and potential barriers, transferable skills and experience, career aptitude, motivation, and education level. Working in conjunction with the DTS/Timekeeper and Service Coordination Team, the results ensure these assessments become the corner stone for developing and implementing an individualized service plan designed to address the participants short and long-term goals in a timely manner. The candidate should have a background in Case Management and/or Assessment and Social Service, staff supervision, and a willingness and desire to work with at-risk and vulnerable populations. They will reflect the Fedcap values of teamwork, collaboration, and innovation.


Wage/Salary: $62,430.00


**Essential Job Functions:**

* Provide supervision and professional development to the Service Coordination Team and DTS/Timekeeper.
* Manage the development, administration, and implementation of various assessment tools to ascertain barriers and employment, training, and educational goals.
* Manage the development individualized service plans based on participant barriers and goals.
* Ensure each assessment is tailored to the individual.
* Ensure that outreach is performed by the Service Coordination Team in effort to maintain active client engagement in program services.
* Ensure that timekeeping is conducted with accuracy and in a timely manner in both FedcapCares & HRA’s systems.
* Review participant documentation for legitimacy and ensuring its uploaded to FedcapCares system.
* Manage and evaluate the effectiveness of both department processes, promoting a smooth transition and short wait time for participants.
* Create, distribute and monitor tracking reports for both departments to evaluate staff performance towards vendor site’s assigned EP/ISP goals.
* Manage to provide excellent customer service in a welcoming professional environment.
* Ensure proper accommodations and flexibility are provided within reason for all participants.
* Communicate effectively with the Service Coordination Team and DTS/Timekeeper to ensure a proper pipeline between them both are collaborative and seamless.
* Develop and implement a process for reassessing participants as needed, including re-referred participants.
* Follow approved policies and procedures regarding the daily participant engagement and attendance policies to recipients of public assistance.
* Ensure that case noting of participant scheduled engagement activities and attendance are done in Fedcap internal and Funder external systems.
* Ensure that information is being provided to all participants regarding Fedcap services, including employment services, vocational trainings, and educational services.
* Performs other duties as assigned. This job description is not designed to cover or contain a comprehensive listing of activities, duties, or responsibilities.

**Education and Experience:**

* 4-year degree in social work, counseling, or a related field required or a minimum of 4 years’ experience in case management or assessment.
* At least 1 year of supervisory experience or experience as a lead, preferably in case management or service assessment.
* Experience working with populations on public assistance, criminal backgrounds, and the economically disadvantaged.
* Excellent communication skills
* Excellent data entry skills and attention to detail.

**QUALIFICATIONS:** To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.
 

**WORK ENVIRONMENT:** The work environment characteristics described here are representative of those an employee encounters while performing the essential functions of this job.  



**Equal Opportunity Employer**


  
**Mission:** Fedcap, Inc. makes high outcome, life-changing, sustainable differences for individuals and families to improve their economic well-being through work.
  

  

Fedcap, Inc. offers a wide array of programs and services to help individuals achieve success in education and employment and become self-sufficient adults. Our specific focus areas include case management, work readiness, vocational and employer based training, job placement and post placement supports.
  

  

Fedcap, Inc. provides a broad range of services to thousands of individuals across a growing footprint, helping them achieve economic and social well-being. Our team of talented, caring staff are passionate about our work. They are committed to ensuring that every individual served can experience the dignity that comes from a job.
  

  

Fedcap, Inc. launched as part of The Fedcap Group in 2018.
  

  

**Website:** https://fedcapinc.org/

title: Skills Trainer (Pre-ETS)
description:
**JOB SUMMARY**

In 1935, Fedcap Rehabilitation Services was founded by three men in NYC who had sustained injuries in WWI and literally changed the world for people with physical disabilities. It now provides an array of services to youth and adults helping thousands each year graduate from high school, obtain vocational certification or a college degree, become work-ready, obtain meaningful employment, and achieve long-term economic well-being. Renamed The Fedcap Group in 2018, Fedcap Rehabilitation Services continues to be a trailblazer in providing opportunities for people with challenges and disabilities and their families.


Mission: To create opportunities for people with barriers to economic well-being.


Coordinates internship activities related to the development and operation of a paid internship program for HS students

Program Manager Support


* Develops resumes.
* Assists students in fulfilling curriculum requirements and monitors progress.
* Communicates with parents on student’s progress.
* Participates in networking opportunity events.

Internship Coordination

Completes all documentation in a timely and professional manner; maintains excellent communication with stakeholders, including monthly update reports to referring counselor.

Education


Bachelor’s (BA or BS) required.


Job Experience

Knowledge, Skills, & Abilities

	+ Mission, vision, and goals of The Fedcap Group and execution of relevant policies and procedures.
	+ Strong organizational, administration, presentation, and communication skills (both verbal and written).
	+ Microsoft Office and internet skills.
	+ Vocational needs of individuals with disabilities.

Software Skills


Proficient with Microsoft Office Suite or related software.


Other

* Excellent verbal/written communication and presentation skills.
Excellent organizational skills and attention to detail.

title: LCSW/LPC/LMFT Clinician
description:
Description:

Under the direct supervision of their supervisor, the Clinician provides client-driven services in a timely, prompt manner within the agency practice setting. They will provide direct clinical services and may carry the responsibility for specialized services and duties as assigned by their supervisor. The Clinician will meet or exceed agency expectations of the number of scheduled weekly sessions and is available to their client caseload if an urgent need arises.


Requirements:
**Duties and Responsibilities:**


Within the framework of the agency’s services, the Clinician is required to perform the duties listed below:

* Provide direct counselling services (including individual, couples, family and/or group treatment practices) to a range of agency clients. The Clinician will incorporate up to date and evidence-based counselling techniques and strategies into practice when appropriate and may utilize a specialty in a particular area of practice.
* Evaluate client’s psychosocial needs, history, and status to develop initial diagnostic assessment.
* Create and implement treatment/service plans based on client’s stated treatment goals. Evaluate, modify, and/or change client’s treatment goals, based on progress and within state regulations.
* Responsible for up-to-date record keeping and report writing, as needed.
* Assess client’s financial needs and recommend assistance or other budgetary expenditures for clients when appropriate.
* Collaborate with supervisor, and Director of Clinical Services regarding clinical needs of clients.
* Provide mental health education and support to community groups, as needed.
* Participate in Agency quality assurance and utilization review when asked.
* Self-evaluate professional progress in skill development, reflective abilities, and growth objectives annually with supervisor.
* Responsible for practicing in accordance with the agency policies and procedures and the NASW code of ethics.
* Contributes ideas and suggestion to agency policies, practices, procedures, and programs; may serve as staff representative liaison with interdepartmental and Agency Board Committees.
* Maintains active involvement in the social welfare policy as related to primary area of service responsibility, participates in professional seminars, conferences, workshops, etc., to increase professional knowledge; incorporates new developments into practice whenever appropriate; may prepare written material for publication for own professional development, contribution to the field and enhancement of agency image, programs, or related services.
* Responsible for interpreting the agency’s services to community groups, synagogues, organizations, and others.

**Skills Required:**

* Ability to communicate clearly verbally and in written form.
* Ability to make home visits, as needed.
* Ability to operate a motor vehicle, as needed.
* Able to handle stress without significant impairment to functioning.
* Ability to apply new learning to the practice environment.
* Ability to absorb new ideas and attitudes.
* Ability to form therapeutic relationship with clients and positive collegial relationships.
* Ability to organize and manage workload.
* Ability to keep records.
* Familiarity with and sensitivity to Jewish identity (including its religious, ethical, cultural, and social values).

**Education and Experience required:**

* Graduation from an accredited mental health master’s program (i.e.: social work, psychology, counseling, marriage, and family therapy)
* New Jersey Clinical Licensure (i.e., LCSW, LPC, LMFT)

**Physical Requirements (if any):**


The physical requirements described are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential duties and responsibilities of this position. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential duties and responsibilities. While performing this job, one typically spends time sitting, walking, standing, driving, listening, speaking, typing, reading, and writing. In addition, an employee may be asked to carry or lift up to 20 lbs.

title: Paralegal
description:
Quintairos, Prieto, Wood & Boyer, P.A., a multi-office national firm has an immediate opening for a Paralegal for our New York City office. This is a full-time position, competitive salary and benefits package offered.

**JOB SUMMARY**


The paralegal performs a variety of complex duties with limited supervision. The individual in this role primarily supports attorneys with workers' compensation defense matters.

**PRIMARY DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES**

* Investigates facts and law of cases and searches pertinent sources, public records to determine causes of action and to prepare cases.
* Gathers and analyzes research data, such as statutes, decisions and legal articles, codes and documents.
* Prepares for trial by performing tasks such as organizing exhibits.
* Organizes and analyzes documentary evidence including contracts, records, reports, depositions, discovery, investigative and other documents and summaries. Interpretation and preparation of chronologies and summaries as requested.
* Under attorney direction, drafts and prepares correspondence and other written documents as required including responses, reports, filings, pleadings, answers, motions, interrogatories, contracts, opinions, position papers, letters, etc., and other documents as necessary.
* Prepares and handles tracking and disposition of subpoenas or other request for information.
* Ensures organization of files including maintenance and management.
* Monitors files and escalates issues requiring attorney involvement. Performs timely handling of highly sensitive issues and materials related to case.
* Communicates with clients, witnesses, experts.
* Maintains calendar for trial and discovery deadlines. Obtains trial settings, coordinates and assist in preparation.
* Performs other duties as assigned.

**REQUIREMENTS**

* 2-3+ years of prior paralegal experience supporting workers' compensation defense litigators preferably in a high-volume, fast-paced law firm environment.
* New York court filing experience including e-filing experience.
* New Jersey court filing experience including e-filing experience a plus.
* Experience handling general liability cases preferred.
* Requires critical thinking skills, superior communication and organizational skills, decisive judgment and the ability to work in a team environment with minimal supervision and manage and prioritize multiple projects and tasks.
* Proficiency in MS Word, Excel, PowerPoint and Outlook and knowledge and application of legal research tools (Westlaw).
* High School Diploma or its equivalent required.

 **Benefits**


Our firm offers competitive salaries and a comprehensive benefits package for full-time hourly employees including medical, dental & vision insurance, employer paid life insurance, employer paid short-term disability insurance, generous 401(k) plan match, paid vacation, and more. Benefit offerings for positions other than full-time may vary.

**Physical Demands**


This position is considered to be mostly sedentary and will require the employee to sit for extended periods of time. It will also require the employee to occasionally stand, walk, and reach with hands and arms. They may engage in bending, stretching, reaching and other motions in the course of a working day. They will be engaged in using office equipment and computers. They may engage in lifting of supplies and materials up to 20 pounds from time to time. While performing duties of this position, the employee is regularly required to see, talk and hear.

**Working Conditions**


This job is located primarily in an indoor office environment with varying noise levels. There may be varying degrees of temperature. The employee may be interrupted from time to time.


The above statements are not intended to be an exhaustive list of all responsibilities and activities required of the position. They are intended to describe the general nature and level of work being performed for this job.


Compensation commensurate with experience. QPWB is an Equal Opportunity Employer seeking enthusiastic candidates eager to work in a fast-paced and challenging environment.

title: Manager, Training and Technical Assistance
description:
**Company Overview:**
Public Health Solutions (PHS) is a 501(c)3 non-profit community-based organization (CBO) that has existed for 70 years to improve health equity and address health-related social needs (HRSN) for historically underserved marginalized communities. As the largest public health nonprofit serving New York City, we improve health outcomes and help communities thrive by providing services directly to vulnerable families, supporting community-based organizations through our long-standing public-private partnerships, and bridging the gap between healthcare and community services. We focus on a wide range of public health issues including food and nutrition, health insurance, maternal and child health, sexual and reproductive health, tobacco control, and HIV/AIDS. Learn more about our work at healthsolutions.org.

 **Program Description:**


PHS administers WholeYouNYC (WYNYC), a coordinated community resource network that builds trustworthy and reliable pathways between healthcare providers, health plans and CBOs providing critical resources in the community that address the social drivers of health. WYNYC brings together over 100 organizations offering various programs – such as food, housing, employment, health insurance, and sexual health services – across all five boroughs. These services and programs make it possible for New Yorkers to live their healthiest lives and ultimately reduce health disparities and advance health equity. To date, our network has already impacted thousands of lives through community partnerships and referrals, generating millions in estimated healthcare savings.

  

New York State (NYS) recently announced the availability of $500M statewide to support Social Care Network (SCN) lead entities responsible for coordinating social care delivery in various regions across the state. Public Health Solutions (PHS) and our WYNYC network were awarded the role of regional SCN for Brooklyn, Manhattan, and Queens.  

This is a grant-funded position ending March 31, 2027. **Position Summary:**


We seek an experienced manager to oversee WholeYouNYC-SCN training and technical assistance activities for health-related social needs (HRSN) service providers (“network partners”). The manager will work closely with the Healthcare-Community Partnerships Capacity Building Team, other network care delivery teams and capacity building partners to enhance HRSN service provider SCN knowledge capacity and engagement. The Manager, Training and Technical Assistance will draw upon SCN care delivery and social services navigation expertise to ensure training and technical assistance activities maximize value for network partners.

 **Specifically, the Manager Training and Technical Assistance will:**

* Manage partner training and technical assistance activities for the SCN promoting a culture of engagement, network quality and efficiency.
* Develop a mastery level understanding of the SCN care delivery process and act as a subject matter advisor providing leadership, guidance and best practice techniques to network staff and partners.
* Collaborate with other teams and network partners to develop and implement a comprehensive SCN training curricula for network partners.
* Collaborate with other teams and network partners to oversee designation of the SCN’s screening and navigation workforce ensuring their readiness to provide services on behalf of the network.
* Contribute to the design and implementation of a comprehensive partner onboarding program supporting documentation and tool development, as needed.
* Manage the SCN partner onboarding process, working collaboratively with other internal teams and external partners, as needed, to enable seamless and efficient onboarding onto the network.
* Develop and oversee the management and maintenance of an SCN Knowledge Hub ensuring a repository of readily available and accessible resources for network partners.
* Design and implement tailored technical assistance solutions and processes that enhance CBO knowledge capacity and enable their successful participation in the SCN.
* Plan and oversee network technical assistance activities to include, but not limited to partner 1:1s, office hours, CBO roundtables and other engagement events and forums.
* Design, develop and implement monitoring and evaluation methods to assess the effectiveness of network training and technical assistance initiatives.
* Lead and/or support network partner trainings including direct support for and management of materials / plan / schedule development, delivery and post training evaluation and analysis.
* Document best practices and lessons learned from training and technical assistance activities and propose and implement SCN continuous improvement recommendations.
* Work collaboratively with other SCN care delivery teams and Quality Improvement & Evaluation to develop and implement performance monitoring protocols for SCN care delivery activities.
* Oversee the development and execution of a CBO performance evaluation plan and scorecard. Develop and implement corrective action plans to address identified CBO performance issues.
* Provide direct oversight, supervision and performance management for Training and Technical Assistance Coordinators supporting the WholeYouNYC-SCN.
* Perform other related duties, as assigned.

**Qualifications and Experience:**

* Bachelor’s Degree or equivalent preferably in public health, health education or a related field.
* Minimum 3 years of experience in a project management, managerial or supervisory role.
* Proven professional experience developing and delivering training and/or technical assistance, preferably in a public health setting.
* Strong professional knowledge of effective social needs screening and referral practices.
* Understanding of the health and human services sector in NYC/NYS and related government agencies.
* Foundational knowledge of the social drivers of health (SDoH) and their impact on health outcomes.
* Excellent interpersonal skills (verbal, written and presentation).
* Strong organizational skills with the ability to handle multiple tasks simultaneously.
* Excellent attention to detail, accuracy and dependability.
* Ability to travel occasionally across Brooklyn, Queens and Manhattan.
* Salary - $77,000 - $77,000.

**Desired Skills:**

* MPH, MPA or related Master’s Degree.
* Bilingual language skills.
* Experience working with Medicaid.

**Benefits:*** Hybrid Work Schedule.
* Generous Paid Time Off and Holidays.
* An attractive and comprehensive benefits package including Medical, Dental and Vision.
* Flexible Spending Accounts and Commuter Benefits.
* Company Paid Life Insurance and Disability Coverage.
* 403(b) + employer matching and discretionary company contributions.
* College Savings Plan.
* Ongoing trainings and continuous opportunities for professional growth and development.

  

At PHS, we place immense value on diversity within our teams, understanding that varied backgrounds and experiences significantly enhance our community and propel us toward our goals. If you find you don’t have experience in all the areas listed above, we still encourage you to apply and share your background and experiences in your application. We are eager to discover how your unique perspective can bring positive transformations to our team and help advance our mission of creating healthier, more equitable communities.

  

We look forward to learning more about you!

 *PHS is proud to be an equal opportunity employer and encourages applications from women, people of color, persons with disabilities, LGBTQIA+ individuals, and veterans.*

title: Product Manager, Integrated Public Health Sur
description:
**Job description:**
DOHMH is seeking a **Product Manager** to spearhead the development of data products within our Integrated Public Health Data Infrastructure portfolio. The Product Manager will determine and oversee delivery of the strategy and roadmap for their products to achieve equitable public health outcomes including the goals set by NYC DOHMH’s Healthy NYC initiative. Their responsibilities include coordinating with colleagues in the Division of Information Technology, as well as stakeholders across key public health programs to set priorities, manage new development and operations, and provide direction and oversight to product teams and other technical support teams supporting the Data Modernization Initiative. **Duties:*** Develop a deep understanding of business goals and processes to inform data product priorities and improvement recommendations.
* Develop strong relationships and regularly communicate with program stakeholders to shape the product strategy and surface and prioritize needs.
* Monitor the public health ecosystem and emerging technology trends to inform product strategy and proactively propose new solutions.
* Establish product roadmaps and release plans that satisfy requirements and achieve agency goals and public health outcomes.
* Contribute to translating business requirements into actionable product and technical requirements.
* Continuously monitor and evaluate product performance and proactively champion product improvements.
* Guide the cross-functional development team (including colleagues from IT, data engineering, data science) to scope, plan and deliver work, applying established delivery methodologies (e.g., agile methods) and best practices (e.g., reusability).
* Proactively identify and resolve blockers to achieve business objectives for the product, including technical and resourcing challenges.
* Ensure alignment and adherence to City/Agency, financial and IT standards (e.g., architecture, compliance, security).
* Increase adoption and consumption of product capabilities.
* Manage investment decision making and finances for the products, taking a return-on-investment approach to increasing the value while minimizing product costs.
* Serve as product manager for multiple, related products.
* Define, track, and communicate relevant KPIs for the product to measure performance and contribution to business goals and strategy.

 **Qualifications:****REQUIRED*** 3+ years of product management or related experience.
* Master’s degree in public health, data science, health informatics, computer science, or a related field.
* Understanding of public health and population health data, including concepts like HL7, interoperability and others.
* Understanding of data systems, data governance, data analytics
* Ability to lead cross-functional teams and work collaboratively across diverse and matrixed stakeholders.
* Ability to surface, prioritize, and balance multiple stakeholder priorities.
* Strong project management skills to manage multiple projects and deadlines simultaneously.
* Demonstrated success in defining and building data and technology products.
* Excellent problem solving and analytical skills, including experience analyzing and leveraging data to inform decision making.
* Demonstrated ability to communicate complex technical information effectively to various stakeholders verbally and in writing.
* Ability to adapt and respond to changes due to emerging public health needs and priorities.
* Salary - $120,000 - $120,000

**ADDITIONAL DESIRED QUALITIES*** Background in public health is preferred
* Preferred technological proficiency: R, Python, SQL, HTML, JavaScript, DataWrapper, GitHub, SAS, bash
* Preferred experience: Interpreting, analyzing, and drawing conclusions from epidemiological and other public health or publicly sourced data

**Why Join Us:*** Directly contribute to advancing public health in New York City and setting best practices globally through innovative data products.
* Lead the transformative integration of modern data practices with epidemiology and health informatics to define the next era of timely and effective public health strategies.
* Be part of a mission-focused organization that is one of the largest public health agencies in the world, serving 8.5 million New Yorkers from diverse ethnic and cultural backgrounds and dedicated to improving their health and wellbeing.
* Enjoy a supportive work environment that values diversity, innovation, learning, and professional growth.

**Additional Information:*** **This is a temporary grant-funded position ending November 2027, with the possibility of continuation as a DOHMH employee.**
* Preference may be given to individuals residing in New York City (5 boroughs) or surrounding New York State counties.
* This individual will be required to reside in the Tri-State Area (New York, New Jersey, and/or Connecticut)
* This individual will be expected to work non-business hours during emergencies.

 *PHS is proud to be an equal opportunity employer and encourages applications from women, people of color, persons with disabilities, lesbian, gay, bisexual and transgender individuals, and veterans.*  


  

Monday-Friday  

possibility of hybrid work  

35 Hours Per week

title: Client Strategy Director - Activation
description:
Description:
**The Role**

  

The Client Strategy Director for Activation supports Indie Consulting’s service teams in delivering cutting-edge growth marketing strategies. Collaborating closely with the CEO and Service Team Leads, this marketing leader will concentrate on driving client growth through tactical execution, optimizing marketing campaigns, and building a high-performing team of growth marketing experts. This role will be pivotal in shaping and executing Indie Consulting’s activation strategy.

**Who We Are**

  

Founded in 2019, Indie has evolved into a team of 20 experienced marketers across the U.S. We are a data-driven marketing consultancy providing in-sourced talent to collaborate on digitally-led strategy, brand activation, optimization, and upskilling. Our values—understanding, making a difference, curiosity, commitment, and leadership—guide our work. We serve a diverse range of clients from startups to multi-national CPGs, focusing on both strategy and tactical execution. Our team of ambitious learners is dedicated to performance-driven marketing rooted in empathy.

**Responsibilities**

  

The Client Strategy Director for Activation will oversee and advance Indie Consulting’s client services with a focus on **go to market growth marketing tactics**. As a Client Strategy Director, you will:

* Lead a portfolio of client accounts with a focus on driving measurable growth.
* Manage a team of full-time employees and contractors to implement best-in-class growth marketing strategies.
* Balance long-term planning (12 months+) with short-term activation tactics to achieve and exceed revenue goals.
* Analyze client business challenges and opportunities to recommend and execute data-driven, growth-focused marketing tactics.
* Drive the implementation of Indie’s activation strategy, ensuring alignment with client objectives and business goals.
* Lead cross-functional teams to execute campaigns, optimize workflows, and deliver results.
* Utilize creative problem-solving skills to find mutually beneficial solutions for Indie and our clients.
* Demonstrate a deep understanding of various business models and apply growth marketing principles to solve client challenges.
* Guide the Indie team in developing and executing growth marketing plans that meet client objectives.
* Continuously optimize campaign workflows and processes to enhance client outcomes.
* Rapidly acquire business acumen across multiple verticals to become a trusted expert in growth marketing.
* Develop and maintain strong engagement plans with clients and partners.
* Champion thought leadership in growth marketing tactics and activation strategies.
* Contribute to the creation and refinement of client-facing playbooks and ways of working.
* Inspire and mentor direct and indirect reports with a passion for all aspects of growth marketing.
* Identify and capitalize on new opportunities for clients, translating them into actionable strategies and profitable initiatives.
* Lead cross-functional teams in the development of project briefs, proposals, and new business opportunities.
* Upskill the team in translating business goals into actionable growth marketing strategies, critical thinking, and effective communication.
* Perform other duties as assigned by the CEO.


Requirements:
**Who You Are**

* Proven experience in digital marketing and media with a strong focus on growth marketing tactics. Experience in media buying/planning or working with global teams is a plus.
* Extensive experience in developing and managing client strategies, particularly with a focus on driving growth through paid, earned & owned marketing activation.
* A successful track record in creating and implementing multi-year growth plans for clients.
* Ability to introduce and evangelize innovative growth marketing tactics and activation strategies.
* Strong relationship-building skills with internal and external stakeholders, including executive teams and industry groups.
* Expertise in media, marketing, and technical subject matter with the ability to communicate complex ideas effectively.
* In-depth understanding of growth marketing strategies, including how data, media, owned platforms, measurement, and technology drive client success.
* Skilled in leveraging people, resources, and services to achieve company objectives.
* Ability to promote service offerings, nurture leads, and close deals to meet and exceed revenue targets.
* Excellent negotiation and influencing skills.
* Highly organized with strong attention to detail.

**Skills, Knowledge & Qualifications**

* 10+ years of experience in a strategic or client services role, preferably in a professional services, agency, or consulting environment.
* Demonstrated success in balancing business development with managing an existing client portfolio.
* Experience leading marketing projects from discovery through execution, with a focus on growth marketing tactics.
* Deep understanding of omnichannel marketing, branding, and emerging technologies that drive growth for clients.
* Strong client expectation management skills with the ability to navigate nuanced situations.
* Exceptional communication skills, with the ability to simplify complex ideas and handle challenging situations with grace and empathy.
* Familiarity with agile methodologies is a plus.
* Excellent written, presentation, and verbal communication skills.
* Willingness to travel 20-30%, depending on internal team and client needs.

**Reporting Relationships:** This position reports to the CEO.

 **Location:** New York, NY in a hybrid work setting (split between working from home, shared offices, and client locations).

 **Compensation:** As required by applicable Pay Transparency laws, Indie Consulting provides a range of minimum compensation for roles that may be hired in locations under these requirements. The salary range for this role is $140,000-$160,000 per year, with potential commission and bonus eligibility up to $200K+ annually. Additional benefits include health insurance and a 401k plan.

title: Project Manager - Construction
description:
Join a rapidly growing company with a robust pipeline of work! We are seeking an experienced Project Manager to oversee several public projects across Northern New Jersey, as well as Orange and Rockland Counties in New York. Our projects primarily involve the delivery and installation of new parks, playgrounds, turf fields, tennis and pickleball courts, and utilities work. Over the past five years, we've seen significant growth by building strong relationships with our clients, and we're looking for a dedicated professional to help manage our expanding workload and contribute to our continued success.

Key Responsibilities:

Manage daily project activities, ensuring effective communication with vendors, owners, and resident engineers.

Prepare and oversee various project submittals.

Administer contracts, including the creation and submission of pay applications.

Handle material purchasing, process purchase orders, manage tax exemptions, and coordinate with vendors during the project buyout phase.

Oversee project closeout processes, including bond and insurance submittals.

Requirements:

Strong communication skills and the ability to proactively resolve issues.

A minimum of 4 years of experience in construction project management, preferably with public sector projects.

Proficiency in MS Office, with strong email and verbal communication skills.

A hands-on “Doer” mentality, eager to work collaboratively and grow with the business.

Willingness to travel to job sites, attend meetings, and negotiate with engineers. The office is located in Pearl River, NY.

Must be able to adapt quickly to varying workloads and projects

Ability to speak Spanish is a plus, but not reqiuired

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $80,000.00 - $110,000.00 per year

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* Health insurance
* Paid time off

Schedule:

* 8 hour shift
* Day shift
* Monday to Friday
* Overtime

Experience:

* Project management: 4 years (Preferred)

Ability to Commute:

* Pearl River, NY (Required)

Ability to Relocate:

* Pearl River, NY: Relocate before starting work (Required)

Work Location: In person

title: Early Learning Before and After School Program Director
description:
Description:
**WHO WE ARE:** Healthy Kids is NY & NJ's fastest-growing provider of Early Learning, Before and After School, and Summer Camp Programs with over 100 locations and growing. We are a Certified Benefit Corporation reinventing accessible and affordable childcare for today’s families and creating opportunities for teachers and caregivers to do what they love (and feel valued while they’re doing it). Join our award-winning community to provide the quality program children deserve while pursuing your own professional growth and development. Learn more about working with us at healthykidsprograms.com/workwithus.


We are currently hiring a director for our Before and After School Early Learning Program located at Mamaroneck Avenue Elementary School in Mamaroneck, NY.

**JOB STATUS:** Part-Time, Non-Exempt

**HOURS**: 7:30am - 9:30am and 3:30pm - 6:00pm

**PAY:** $19-$20 per hour

**JOB CONSISTS OF:**


Ensure staff and program complies with OCFS guidelines, Healthy Kids Extended Day Program policies, and host school policies


Direct hands-on activities following the Healthy Kids Curriculum which include fitness, STEAM, academic, art, and other group activities as well as homework completion.


Perform management functions such as accurate attendance records, registration, and staffing.


Provide continual communication with parents and family members via the Brightwheel App.


Communicate effectively and regularly with your direct report, keeping them abreast of daily occurrences and issues as they arise and in a timely manner, working collaboratively as a team to provide the highest quality of care, a positive working environment and to problem solve proactively.


Requirements:
**EDUCATION AND EXPERIENCE:**


To be qualified as a Director, a person must possess either:

* An associate's degree in early childhood or related field, with a plan of study leading to a bachelor's degree or a New York State children's program administrator credential; two years of full-time teaching experience in a child care center, family or group family day care home or another early childhood program; and two years of experience supervising staff in a child care program or a related field of work;


or

* A bachelor's degree, including or in addition to 12 credits in early childhood, child development, or a related field; one year of full-time teaching experience in a child care center, family or group family day care home, or another early childhood program; and one year of experience supervising staff in a child care program or a related field of work;


or

* A New York State children's program administrator credential; one year of full-time teaching experience in a child care center, family or group family day care home, or another early childhood program; and one year of experience supervising staff in a child care program or a related field of work;


or

* A child development associate credential or another office-recognized credential, with a plan of study leading to a bachelor's degree or a New York State children's program administrator credential; two years of full-time teaching experience in a child care center, family or group family day care home or another early childhood program; and two years of experience supervising staff in a child care program or a related field of work.

**QUALIFICATIONS:**

* Get ready to ace a background check, including fingerprinting, references, SEL & SCR through NYS Office of Children and Family Services.
* You've got the green light from your doctor - medically fit to rock all the job duties and free of any communicable diseases including TB.
* You’re warm, friendly, and upbeat. Exceptional people skills are your jam, whether it's with young children, parents, or fellow team members. Plus, you're professional, reliable, and always prompt.
* You're able to lead and motivate a team and have a commitment to providing quality childcare.
* You're ready to bend, stretch, lift, carry (up to 50 lbs.), and basically do whatever it takes to keep up with young children!

**PART-TIME PERKS:**

* **On-Demand Pay:** Because why wait for payday when you can have your money when you need it?
* **Telehealth Benefits:** Stay healthy and happy with access to virtual care
* **401(k) for eligible employees PLUS a 1% employer match:** Yep, we're serious about your future too!
* **Paid Sick Time Off:** Because everyone needs a break sometimes.
* **Career Development:** Level up your skills and expertise on us!
* **Growth Opportunities:** We’re growing and we need people to grow with us!
* **AFLAC Supplemental Plans**: Because we believe in going above and beyond to take care of our team.
* **Did we mention certain applicants qualify for tuition assistance?** Reach out to us for all the details!


But wait, there's more! For our full-time team members, we've got some extra perks:

* **Paid Holidays:** Because who doesn't love a day off to celebrate?
* **Health, Dental, and Vision Insurance:** Your health matters, and we've got you covered!
* **Life Insurance:** Peace of mind for you and your loved ones.
* **Short Term and Long Term Disability Insurance:** We've got your back, no matter what life throws your way.

*Healthy Kids is dedicated to creating a workforce that promotes and supports diversity and inclusion. We prohibit discrimination and harassment of any kind based on race, color, sex, religion, sexual orientation, national origin, disability, genetic information, pregnancy, or any other protected characteristic as outlined by federal, state, or local laws.*

*This policy applies to all employment practices within our organization, including hiring, recruiting, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, leave of absence, compensation, benefits, training, and apprenticeship. Healthy Kids Programs makes hiring decisions based solely on qualifications, merit, and business needs at the time. For more information, visit: healthykidsprograms.com*
company_description: Providing Early Learning, Before & After School and Summer Camp Programs in over 150 locations and growing!

description:

title: Project Consultant (Sales)
description:
Description:
**Ready to Take Charge of Your Success? Join Blue Nail Exteriors as a Project Consultant**


Are you driven by independence, motivated by uncapped earning potential, and ready to be recognized for your success? At Blue Nail Exteriors, we offer you the opportunity to manage your own sales process with the support of our office team, all while being rewarded for your hard work and achievements.

**What You’ll Do:**

* Convert warm, scheduled leads into satisfied customers using Blue Nail's Sales Training.
* Independently manage the entire sales process, from initial consultation to closing the deal.
* Build strong, trust-based relationships with homeowners, ensuring a smooth and successful project experience.
* Focus on achieving sales goals, driven by the financial incentives of a commission-based role.
* Be recognized and rewarded for your success, with opportunities to be acknowledged as a top performer.

**What’s In It for You:**

* **Independence:** Manage your sales process autonomously with the support of pre-scheduled leads.
* **Unlimited Earnings:** Commission-based role with uncapped earning potential.
* **Meaningful Recognition:** Your achievements will be celebrated, with opportunities for acknowledgment and rewards that reflect your impact.

**Are You the Right Fit?** We’re seeking someone who is:

* An independent thinker who excels with autonomy
* Financially motivated by a commission-based structure
* Strategic and detail-oriented in their approach to sales
* Proud to have their success acknowledged and rewarded

**Why You’ll Love Working Here:**

* Freedom to manage your workload with the trust and support of our leadership team
* Uncapped earning potential directly tied to your performance
* Supportive environment with the resources to help you succeed
* Meaningful recognition and rewards for contributing to our growth


If you’re an independent, results-driven professional looking to thrive in a sales role that values autonomy and success, submit your resume and cover letter to join our team at Blue Nail Exteriors.


Requirements:
* **Sales Experience:** Proven experience in a sales role, preferably in a consultative environment where understanding customer needs and offering tailored solutions is key.
* **Independence:** Ability to manage your own sales process from start to finish, with minimal supervision.
* **Relationship Building:** Strong interpersonal skills with the ability to build trust-based relationships with homeowners.
* **Financial Motivation:** Comfort with a commission-based compensation structure, with the drive to maximize earning potential.
* **Strategic Thinking:** Ability to think ahead, plan your approach, and execute a strategic sales process.
* **Detail-Oriented:** Keen attention to detail, ensuring accuracy and thoroughness throughout the sales cycle.
* **Tech Savvy:** Proficiency with digital tools and software, including CRM systems, to manage leads and track progress.
* **Communication Skills:** Excellent verbal and written communication skills to effectively interact with customers and team members.
* **Valid Driver’s License:** Must have a valid driver’s license and reliable transportation to visit clients as needed.
* **Work Environment:** Ability to operate in a smoke-free and drug-free workplace.

title: Project Advocate
description:
Description:
**Make an Impact as a Project Advocate at Blue Nail Exteriors**


Are you passionate about creating exceptional customer experiences while ensuring that every detail of a project is handled with care? As a Project Advocate at Blue Nail Exteriors, you’ll be the face of our company in the neighborhoods we serve, helping homeowners and supporting our crews to ensure smooth, successful projects that leave everyone smiling.

**What You’ll Do:**

* Generate and nurture leads by engaging with homeowners and their neighbors, creating interest in our roofing, siding, and window services.
* Support our crews on-site, ensuring they have what they need to do their best work, keeping job sites clean and organized.
* Build strong, trust-based relationships with customers, serving as their go-to person throughout their project.
* Focus on achieving customer satisfaction, turning happy clients into advocates who refer us to others and leave five-star reviews.
* Manage multiple projects simultaneously, ensuring that each one is completed on time and to the highest standards.

**What’s In It for You:**

* **Engagement:** A role that allows you to interact with homeowners, crews, and communities, making every day dynamic and rewarding.
* **Title & Recognition:** You’ll hold an important position within our company, with your efforts directly contributing to our growth and success.
* **Financial Incentives:** Competitive compensation with opportunities for bonuses based on your success in generating leads and ensuring customer satisfaction.
* **Personal Achievement:** Your hard work will be acknowledged in a way that aligns with your personal style, offering a sense of accomplishment without the need for the spotlight.

**Are You the Right Fit?** We’re seeking someone who is:

* A people person who enjoys interacting with others and building relationships
* Organized and reliable, capable of managing multiple tasks and projects at once
* Customer-focused, driven by the satisfaction of helping others and ensuring positive outcomes
* Proactive and resourceful, always looking for ways to improve the customer experience and support our crews
* Eager to learn, even without prior roofing experience, and ready to apply new skills on the job

**Why You’ll Love Working Here:**

* Engaging work that allows you to make a tangible difference in the communities we serve
* A supportive team environment where your contributions are valued and recognized
* Opportunities for career growth as Blue Nail Exteriors continues to expand
* A rewarding role where your efforts directly contribute to the success of our projects and our company

**Ready to Join Us?**


If you’re an organized, people-oriented professional looking to make an impact as a Project Advocate at Blue Nail Exteriors, we’d love to hear from you. Submit your resume and cover letter to join our team and help us build something special.


Requirements:
**Job Requirements:**

* Previous experience in project coordination, customer service, or a related role is a plus
* Strong communication and interpersonal skills
* Ability to manage multiple projects and tasks simultaneously
* Tech-savvy, with proficiency in digital tools and software for managing projects
* Valid driver’s license

title: X-Ray Technician
description:
**JOB TITLE:** X-Ray Technician**EMPLOYER**: Progressive Spine & Orthopaedics

**S****UMMARY:** Serves as initial contact for all patients visiting the office. Also serves as the X-Ray Technician which duties include explaining procedures to patients, calibrating imaging equipment and preparing results.

**DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:**

* Answers, screens, and directs calls on multi-line phone system; takes detailed messages and/or forwards telephone calls to appropriate practitioner, voice mail, or pager.
* Clears messages each morning and delivers to appropriate practitioner.
* Meets and greets patients; announces, directs, and/or escorts to appropriate area.
* Opens and routes incoming mail.
* Composes and types routine correspondence as required.
* Performs general clerical duties including but not limited to filing, photocopying, faxing, and mailing as required.
* Keeps reception area organized.
* Following instructions from Physicians regarding which area of the patient’s body needs imaging.
* Talk the patient through the procedure and answer questions to lower their anxiety.
* Correctly position the patient, adjust the imaging equipment to the specified position.
* Prevent unnecessary radiation exposure both to themselves and to the patient.
* Follow correct techniques and procedures such as patient shielding.
* Maintain radiology supplies inventory by checking stock, anticipating future needs and placing orders.
* Demonstrates a high level of professionalism in dealing with confidential and sensitive issues.
* Performs other related duties as assigned by management.


**QUALIFICATIONS:**

* Certification in radiologic technology.
* A minimum of 2 years working experience in a healthcare facility as an x-ray or radiology technician.
* Must have the required medical licenses to operate in a given area.
* Must have a clear understanding of how to handle and operate medical imaging equipment.
* Must display a high level of flexibility in the process of carrying out assigned duties and dual responsibilities.
* Excellent verbal and written communication skills to share updates with patients and other medical staff.
* Strong analytical thinking and the ability to handle multiple tasks concurrently.
* Superb customer service skills to provide ongoing support to patients and their families.
* Ability to deal effectively with a diversity of individuals at all organizational levels.
* Commitment to excellence and high standards.
* Strong organizational skills; able to manage priorities and workflow.
* Versatility, flexibility, and a willingness to work within constantly changing priorities with enthusiasm.
* Bilingual skills a plus.
* Professional appearance and demeanor are required at all times.


**GENERAL EXPECTATIONS:**

* Behave in a professional manner and consistently demonstrate and promote the values of respect, honesty, and dignity for the patient, families, and all members of team.
* Committed to the constant pursuit of excellence and teamwork in improving the care of the patients.
* Be punctual with scheduled work and use time appropriately.
* Perform duties in a conscientious, cooperative manner.
* Perform required amount of work in a timely fashion with a minimum of errors.
* Maintain confidentiality and protect the Practice by abiding by laws and principles related to confidentiality; keeps information concerning Practice Operations, patients, and employees confidential.

**BENEFITS:**

* Competitive salary and benefits package
* Health, dental, and vision insurance
* Retirement Plan
* Employee Assistance Program
* Paid Time Off
* Opportunities for professional development and growth
* Collaborative and supportive work environment

**LOCATION & JOB TYPE:**

* Edison, NJ
* Full-Time (no weekends or nights)

  

At Progressive Spine & Orthopaedics, we are committed to maintaining a safe and drug-free workplace. As part of our hiring process, all candidates who receive a job offer will be required to undergo a pre-employment drug test and background check. These steps are essential to ensure the safety and well-being of our employees and patients.

title: Quality Assurance
description:
Description:

The Quality Assurance Analyst position must have extensive knowledge in the areas of regulatory compliance, insurer/guarantor guidelines, client contractual agreements, Servbank policies and Risk procedures. The position is expected to have operational experience in core servicing systems, third party systems for insurers, guarantors and affiliated service providers and operations experience in areas such as but not limited to customer service, collections, default, claims and escrow.


This position is responsible for testing operations processes and controls to assure Servbank is maintaining compliance with all required guidance as well as identifying updates and changes that may be necessary to ensure the processes and controls are in line with updates to the guidance.


This position will be required to provide necessary report results of the testing and risk associated with the actions, curative actions necessary for any defects identified and the timelines for curative action implementation. Collaborate with the lines of business on the necessary resolution plans and monitor implementation through to completion. The candidate may be required to communicate these results to senior management and must possess the communication skills to provide the information in a complete and professional manner. Findings are required to be entered into the Issues Management platform based upon the identified criticality.

**About Servbank**


Founded in 1994, Servbank is a banking institution with local roots and national reach. We were built on a foundation of community-orientation, which ensures that no matter who we serve, we do so with the human touch that marks the gold standard of service. We work with individuals, businesses, and communities, so that whether you’re a student, a homeowner, a small business owner, or a community leader, we can help you fulfill your goals. Come create excellence with Servbank.

**Duties and Responsibilities:**

* Maintain current working knowledge of regulatory compliance requirements related to the mortgage industry.
* Conduct reviews, quality assurance tests of controls, as well as assist department management and other department members with the coordination of internal and external audits, exams or reviews performed by third parties.
* Monitor and analyze investor/insurer periodic status reports to determine root cause of any deficiency trends and submit suggestive corrective action to improve Servbank performance and adherence to requirements.
* Monitors the implementation of corrective action plans with all lines of defense and the lines of business, presenting updates to the findings to the necessary program or committee.
* Assist with, manage, update and monitor parts of the evolution of policies and procedures, training, and compliance programs. Provide input and assistance to the Learning & Development team for training purposes.
* Conducting tests and inspections of processes against policies and procedures as well as regulatory requirements to evaluate quality or performance.
* Evaluate risks of key control deficiencies and effectiveness of overall control framework, and ensure management has effective and timely control remediation plans. Develop and deliver regularly scheduled reports on the results of all reviews performed.
* Assist the other lines of defense in performing risk assessment evaluations of the various lines of business and timely completion entry of the evaluation within the risk management platform.
* Engage Legal, Compliance and other necessary departments for review, approval, and opinions on risk impact, mitigation, and remediation when necessary.
* Source, analyze, coordinate, combine and report data from multiple sources. Create reporting in line with the necessary formats to deliver to management and be digestible by the lines of business.
* Ensure reports are prepared and provided to required committees in a timely manner and design/propose corrective actions as necessary.
* Perform other duties and projects as required by management.
* Must be a self-starter and willing to demonstrate leadership, proactivity and a team building approach.
* Must have strong analytical and investigative skills, be able to work independently, and exercise sound judgment and observe the highest degree of confidentiality in the handling of all audits, reviews, exams or investigation information.


Requirements:
**Experience:**

* High School Degree or equivalent required, BA/BS in Business Administration/Finance preferred or equivalent mortgage banking operations knowledge.
* Minimum 5 years of experience in mortgage banking or mortgage servicing with emphasis in Quality Assurance, Quality Control or Internal Audit.
* Prior experience working with Loan Servicing Systems, particularly MSP and compliance testing systems such as ACES or Ncontracts.
* Knowledge of laws, government regulations, and agency rules; specifically, but not limited to: RESPA, TILA, UDAAP, FDCPA, FDIC and the CFPB as well as investor, insurer and guarantor guidelines (e.g.: FNMA, FHLMC, GNMA, FHA, RHS/USDA, VA)
* Report generation, data analytics, Excel, Business Objects and other data manipulation experience. Report writing for management delivery.

**Education**

* High School Degree or equivalent required, BA/BS in Business Administration/Finance preferred or equivalent mortgage banking operations knowledge.

title: Customer Success Advisor
description:
**Company Information:**


Since 1964, we have been the world’s largest supplier of fudge making equipment, ingredients, and marketing expertise. If you ever go on vacation (and we hope you do!), you’ve probably seen and maybe purchased our fudge. Since our fudge is always made fresh in each retail store (and sold under the retailer’s own name), we are the best kept secret in retail confectionary. With a strong presence in numerous countries and a vast network of retailers, including well-known establishments in the tourism sector, we are committed to delivering outstanding products and services.


Our company culture fosters growth and embodies the "Hungry, Humble, Smart" philosophy. We seek individuals who are driven, self-motivated, and always eager to learn and do more. Being humble, our team members prioritize the team over self and lack excessive ego or concerns about status. Additionally, they possess strong interpersonal skills, enabling them to work effectively with others. We value a strong work ethic and a positive & vibrant work environment.

**Job Summary:**


We are currently seeking a Customer Success Advisor to add to our exceptional team. The primary responsibility of this role is to provide a high-quality experience for our customers, driving loyalty and revenue. The ideal candidate will be communicative and persuasive, able to build strong relationships, and exhibit professionalism and positivity. As the first point of contact for customers, you will ensure they receive the services and support needed to achieve maximum success. We are looking for a critical thinker who is detail-minded, capable of multi-tasking, and can work independently yet also be collaborative.

 **Responsibilities:**

* **Client Relationship Management:** Build and maintain strong client relationships with all customers to become a trusted advisor.
* **Customer Support Program Execution:** Execute the new customer 1st year nurture outward bound support program to ensure customers maximize their 1st-year sales.
* **Service Plan Delivery:** Deliver the existing customer service plan to ensure customer and Calico revenue growth.
* **Best Practices Communication:** Persuasively communicate Calico retail best practices (Calico Critical Success Factors - CSFs) so that customers adopt, implement, and continue to embrace them throughout their lifetime.
* **Issue Resolution:** Complete the feedback loop and ensure all customer nonconformances (including equipment) and complaints are resolved.
* **Field Team Collaboration:** Contact customers after field team visits to offer support, complete follow-up actions, and close the feedback loop.
* **Industry Research:** Continuously research industry trends, solicit customer feedback, and share insights with the leadership team.
* **Process Management:** Manage the new owner of existing processes and the reactivation process.
* **CRM Utilization:** Ensure that all interactions and data are recorded in the CRM system.
* **Performance Review:** Review customer performance and identify opportunities for growth.
* **Equipment Issue Resolution:** Work with customers to resolve all equipment issues.
* **Field Team Assistance:** Assist the outside field team on customer requests.
* **Territory Travel (Future Role Addition):** Travel within a territory to work one-on-one with customers, helping grow their business, sharing insights, and learning from customer interactions.

 **Qualifications:**

* High School Diploma required
* Experience working with a service focused organization
* Record of success exceeding objectives
* Strong work ethic and willingness to go the extra mile
* Excellent verbal and written communication skills
* Ability to meet deadlines

 **As an integral member of our team, you will enjoy a comprehensive benefits program that includes:**

* Competitive Salary
* Paid Time Off Plan and Paid Holidays
* Medical, Dental & Vision Insurance
* Company Paid Long Term Disability Insurance
* Flexible Spending Accounts (FSA) for Health and/or Dependent Care Expenses
* Length of Service Awards
* Employee Assistance Program (employee benefit program that assists employees with personal problems and/or work-related problems that may impact their job performance, health, mental and emotional well-being).
* 401(k) Plan
* Life/AD&D Insurance

 **What makes Calico different from other companies?**

* **Ice Cream Fridays** during fair weather months
* **On-Site Gym** including free fitness classes and personal training with a professional trainer
* **Flu Shot Clinic** held annually on-site
* **Birthday & Holiday Celebrations** held to foster fun and team interaction
* **Employee Appreciation Events** with great food, fun and team building for all team members and their families
* **Charity Drives** held throughout the year to give all Calico team members an opportunity to support our local community
* **Sporting Event** ticket raffles to NY Islanders Hockey and US Tennis Open. We have season tickets to both!
* **Employee Referral Program** financially rewards employees for referring qualified new hires to Calico
* And, of course…**Plenty of the Best Fudge You’ve Ever Tasted!**


Want to make your world a little sweeter? Come join the **Calico Cottage, Inc. team**!


**Job Type:** Full-time/Hourly

**Work Location:** Amityville, NY

**Travel:** 15-25% (This may increase or decrease based on the needs of the business)

**Salary: $26/Hour - $31/Hour**

*Calico Cottage, Inc. provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment and* *prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state, or local laws. This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation, and training.*

title: MARKETING AND EVENTS COORDINATOR
description:
JOB SUMMARY:
The Affordable Housing Alliance is a broad spectrum Human Service Agency whose purpose is to help people improve the quality of their lives through the administration of a number of supportive programs and interventions. The Communications Coordinator is responsible for managing the communication between the organization's public and between its employees. This person will support the AHA Leadership Team and Executive Staff in planning, implementing, and monitoring all internal and external communication strategies and projects.

  

ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS/DUTIES:* Social Media and Online Content Management:
* Responsible for drafting and posting social media and web content according to the agency's social media strategy.
* Maintain agency's presence on social media (Facebook, Instagram, X (Formally Twitter), and LinkedIn).
* Maintain the system for monitoring and reporting on achievement of social media (Likes, clicks, searches)
* Maintain AHA website in conjunction with web team
* Communication and Content Creation:
* Responsible for drafting content, obtaining necessary approvals, and publishing of online newsletters.
* Regularly distribute company notices, public service announcements, etc.
* Assist in corporate branding initiatives: edit scripts, mailings, letters, postings etc.
* Support the Leadership Staff in preparing and modifying communication (including documents, employee correspondence, reports, drafts, memos and emails as needed)
* Marketing and Branding:
* Manages the design and compilation of the Annual Report.
* Oversees the design and production of agency wide and department level marketing materials, collateral, and published communication.
* Act as a liaison for all office marketing needs (Business cards, flyers, booklets, signs, etc.)
* Assist organization in public presence and marketing both in events and media.
* Event Planning and Coordination:
* Assist Leadership Staff in planning of employee outings and events, training, agency fundraising events and resident special events.
* Assist with coordination of Annual Appeal.
* Database Management:
* Maintain Constant Contact and/or any other agency databases for donors, supporters, and constituents.
* Public Relations:
* Serve as "voice" and "face of the AHA for various press and media.


 7. Fundraising:* Support the organization's fundraising efforts, including donor cultivation and fundraising events.
* Collaborate with leadership to develop and implement effective fundraising strategies.
* Maintain records of donations and ensure accurate donor information in the database.
* Assist with thanking donors and ensuring stewardship of donor relationships.


 8. Administrative Support:* Assist in occasional volunteer management.


 9. General Responsibilities:* Any other duties Assigned by the Chief Operating Officer.
* Maintain a positive communication and inclusive culture.

title: Scheduling Coordinator
description:
**Join Our Team:**


Realm, a leader in systems integration, is seeking an enthusiastic Scheduling Coordinator to join our team. Specializing in the integration of advanced control systems, we're reshaping how lighting, security, access control, and entertainment systems are seamlessly blended in both residential and commercial spaces. This is a fantastic opportunity for someone looking to grow their skills and be part of a team renowned for creating sophisticated, user-friendly environments.

**Position Overview:**


The Scheduling Coordinator is tasked with managing and optimizing the scheduling of installations, maintenance, and support services. This role involves coordinating with clients, technicians, and project managers to ensure timely and efficient delivery of services, resolving scheduling conflicts, and maintaining smooth operations.


The ideal candidate will be highly organized, detail-oriented, and capable of managing multiple tasks. The Scheduling Coordinator will play a crucial role in supporting our team and ensuring the smooth operation of daily activities.

**Key Responsibilities:**

* **Scheduling:** Collaborate with our operations team to efficiently manage technician schedules, updating our team calendar and confirming appointments with clients.
* **Timesheets:** Oversee the timesheet submission and approval process for technical and project management teams.
* **RMA Coordination:** Manage the process of returns and exchanges for defective or unwanted products.
* **Client Documentation Management:** Review and maintain client documentation, ensuring accuracy, completeness, and confidentiality to uphold organizational standards and client satisfaction.
* **Administrative Support:** Provide administrative support to the team, including but not limited to answering phone calls, greeting clients, and maintaining a presentable showroom.

**Qualifications:**

* A Bachelor’s Degree is strongly preferred.
* Professional, with attention to detail and a willingness to learn.
* Strong organizational and time management skills with the ability to prioritize tasks and meet deadlines.
* Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to interact professionally with clients, vendors, and team members.
* Ability to work independently with minimal supervision and as part of a team.
* Proficiency in Microsoft Suite, Google Workspace, and Adobe Acrobat.
* A background in SAP preferred but not required.

**Why Join Us?**

* Professional Growth: Work with industry leaders and innovative technology.
* Collaborative Culture: Be part of a team that values innovation and teamwork.
* Career Development: Grow your skills and career in a supportive environment that fosters learning.
* Team Spirit: Be part of a collaborative and passionate team dedicated to technology and service excellence.

**Benefits:**

* 401(k) matching
* Health insurance with 50% company contribution
* Health Savings Account
* Vision insurance
* Dental insurance
* Life insurance
* PTO

**Be a Part of Something Bigger:**


Join Realm and contribute to our mission of integrating technology seamlessly into everyday environments. We're more than a company; we're a community of innovators and thinkers, committed to shaping the future of technology integration.


Apply Now: If you're ready to start your journey as a Scheduling Coordinator with Realm, we're eager to meet you!


Job Type: Full-time


Pay: $60,000 per year


Experience level: 1-2 years


Schedule:

* 8 hour shift
* Monday to Friday
* In person
